summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details multiple trips planned between 2019 and 2020 to conduct witness interviews in locations including Pensacola, West Palm Beach, Los Angeles, and Stockholm, Sweden. The emails show coordination among prosecutors and staff for logistics like flights, hotels, and conference rooms.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Appears as a recipient and sender in travel approval email chains, involved in coordinating travel logistics and authorizations.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) in multiple travel approval email chains, involved in the coordination process.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Primary contact for booking travel logistics (flights, hotels, conference rooms) for the investigation team. Frequently emailed with specific booking requests.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: The primary author of most travel request emails, coordinating trips for witness interviews in the Epstein investigation. Requests approval from Edward Tyrrell.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.role: Supervisory Official (likely Chief of Criminal Division or similar)
persons.context: The official who approves travel authorization requests for the Epstein investigation team. His approval is sought for each trip.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: A member of the investigation team who travels frequently for witness interviews, mentioned as traveling to Pensacola, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: A member of the investigation team who travels for witness interviews, mentioned in trips to West Palm Beach and initially planned for Pensacola.

persons.name: Nick Siu
persons.context: Mentioned once as the person to whom a conference room payment request should be sent, indicating a financial/administrative role.

connections.description: Alex repeatedly requests and receives travel approval from Edward Tyrrell for the Epstein investigation.
Alex provides detailed travel itineraries and booking instructions to Darlene Alleyne, who handles the logistics.
Frequent travel companions for witness interviews as part of the Epstein investigation team.
Travel together for witness interviews, as indicated in several trip requests.
Coordinate on travel authorizations and logistics, with Duncan following up on Alleyne's tasks.
Duncan is copied on Tyrrell's approval emails and is part of the travel coordination chain.

events.title: Witness Interview in Pensacola
events.description: Planned interview of a witness in Pensacola, Florida, conducted by Alex and Alison. Requires hotel and conference room booking.

events.title: Witness Interview near Stockholm
events.description: Planned international interview of a witness near Stockholm, Sweden, involving the investigation team. Includes travel and conference room logistics.

events.title: Witness Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Planned interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles, California, by the investigation team.

events.title: Witness Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Planned interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, conducted by Alex and Maurene.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Planned victim interview in Los Angeles, involving Alex, Alison, and/or Maurene.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Planned travel for meetings and victim interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing investigative activity in the Epstein case (2018R01618) by the SDNY USAO well into 2020, including planned international travel to Sweden.
The investigation involved frequent travel to interview witnesses and victims in multiple U.S. cities (Pensacola, West Palm Beach, Los Angeles) and internationally.
Prosecutors Alex, Alison, and Maurene formed a core travel team conducting these interviews, with Edward Tyrrell as the approving supervisor.
Logistical support staff (Darlene Alleyne, Michele Duncan, Cynthia Perez) handled travel bookings, authorizations, and conference room reservations.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
